source_sentence: 佛說玄師颰陀所說神呪經
translation: Sutra on the Spiritual Dhāraṇī Spell Spoken by the Bodhisattva Bhadra

source_sentence: 東晉天竺三藏竺曇無蘭譯
translation: Translated by Zhu Tanwulan, the Tripiṭaka of the Eastern Jin dynasty
"I heard this.

source_sentence: 一時佛遊於羅閱祇國中鸚鵡樹間。
translation: One time, the Buddha traveled to a parrot tree in the country of Rājagṛha.
There was then a Bhagavān monk.
He was in the bamboo grove on his way to Rājagṛha.
In the middle of it, he was attacked by a snake.
He was also picked up by a spirit.
He was also robbed by a thief.

source_sentence: 見佛爾時即往到是比丘所。
translation: Seeing the Buddha, he then went to that monk's place.
Gengsiddha Bhadrapāla then accompanied the Buddha there.
Xuanshibandhu then said to the Buddha.
"I have a spell that's quite extraordinary, and now I want to write it.
The Buddha said, "Stop, Bhadra!
'Your spell mustn't cause harm.'
Bhadrapāla said to the Buddha.
'Some day, countries will fight each other.
The thieves and the thief will further plunder each other.
Those who increase each other will also have mutual eons.
Ghosts and spirits will further plunder them.
Poison and venom will harm each other.

source_sentence: 若有比丘在山中樹下坐。
translation: Suppose there's a monk sitting under a tree in the mountains.
If he's wearing five patch robes or sitting on the bare ground, his four groups of disciples will make sure no one harms him.

source_sentence: 四輩弟子當令無有害我者。
translation: The four groups of disciples will make sure that no one is harmful to self.

source_sentence: 皆令安隱無有病痛如是。
translation: They'll all be made comfortable and free of illness and pain.'

source_sentence: 僧深味尼欝遮梨首利拔提　珊于兮披拔陀泥如是呪。
translation: *Saṃsāṃnī Ucārya Sholibati Sanjusī Prabhūtanī thus spells it.

source_sentence: 斷口　語斷諸迷斷諸病痛。
translation: "He stops speech, stops delusion, and stops illness and pain.

source_sentence: 是諸閱叉皆作是迷　須摩菟　摩呵(一)曜沙難　摩訶(二)閱叉梵　摩曜摩訶(三)閱叉　因呵羅　其摩呵(四)閱叉呵祇槃摩呵(五)。
translation: All these yakṣas do this misconstruing Sumatra Mahā (1) Yoshana Mahā (2) Yakṣa Brahmā Mahāo Mahā (3) Yakṣa Inhalation Mahā (4) Yakṣa Hagupatta Mahā (5).
"These [are] the honored ones among the demons.

source_sentence: 我字因偷諸欲病者害人者。
translation: 'I'm a word for stealing desires, sicknesses, and harmers of people.'
I cause them not to know the place of people.

source_sentence: 障蔽汝眼令不見一切人。
translation: I'll blind you so that you can't see all people.
They won't be able to get an advantage over you.
At that point, they then call out, saying.
"Come!

source_sentence: 邏持鬼神摩呵　邏持鬼神來。
translation: "Come, Rājagṛha, the demon god Mahārāja!

source_sentence: 兜勒　摩訶兜勒　因持兜羅　來梵　摩訶兜羅　摩訶梵摩　兜羅　來閱叉兜羅　訶多　得　兜勒　首羅俱沙　兜勒　摩訶首羅沙兜勒我字因偷諸怨家　相求便者我皆救之覆蔽兩不相見。
translation: "Tārā, Mahātārā, Indra Tārā, Rājagṛha, Mahātārā, Mahātārā Tārā, Rājagṛha, Tārājagṛha, Mahāsrājagṛha, Tārājagṛha, I'll save those who steal from us and seek their own convenience, covering them up and preventing them from seeing each other.
They're bound by ropes and tethers.
They're bound by chains and weapons.
They're bound by confused thoughts.
They all give their lives to the Buddha, and they're all liberated.

source_sentence: 歸命佛　時南無佛大吉。
translation: I give my life to the Buddha. At the time, Namo Buddha was very auspicious.

source_sentence: 佛說玄師颰陀所說神呪經
translation: The Buddha spoke the Xuansi buddha's sūtra.
